Protected Point to Point Secondary Messages

Error messages are grouped by functionality.

The text of each message is preceeded with the name of the function issuing it so that it can be found easily by software support.

The Description field includes the message type in parentheses. The meanings of the types are:

  • Critical (CRIT): Caused by system errors
  • Error (ERR): Caused by application errors
  • Warning (WARN): Does not cause application shutdown, but indicate the need for adminstrative correction
  • Notice (NOTICE): Information that is always reported, such as startup
  • Information (INFO): Information such as usage statistics. This may be ignored using the -I command line argument

The Response field describes the most reasonable first approach for troubleshooting the problem.

Secondary P3 Key Server Messages

init_key_handler: Failed to allocate key handler data structure: error reason

Description (CRIT):
The P3 secondary attempts to allocate the key handler structure during initialization. If this fails, there is a system wide problem.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.

Secondary P3 Network Messages

init_sec_net: Failed to allocate secondary network data structure: error reason

Description (CRIT):
The P3 secondary attempts to allocate the secondary network structure during initialization. If this fails, there is a system wide problem.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.

Primary P3 Session Messages

init_sec_session: Failed to allocate secondary session data structure: error reason

Description (CRIT):
The P3 secondary attempts to allocate the session structure when a secondary P3 system requests a connection. If this fails, there is a system wide problem.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.

Primary P3 Session Messages

init_sec_ui: Failed to allocate secondary user interface data structure: error reason

Description (CRIT):
The P3 secondary attempts to allocate the user interface structure during initialization. If this fails, there is a system wide problem.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.

Secondary P3 System Messages

p3sec_main: Failed to allocate main p3 secondary data structure: error reason

Description (CRIT):
The P3 secondary attempts to allocate its main structure before any other activity. If this fails, there is a system wide problem.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.
p3sec_main: Failed to allocate main p3 secondary home directory name: error reason

Description (CRIT):
The P3 secondary attempts to allocate the home directory name during initialization. If this fails, there is a system wide problem.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.
p3sec_main: Failed to allocate main p3 secondary home directory name: error reason

Description (CRIT):
The P3 secondary attempts to allocate the configuration filename during initialization. If this fails, there is a system wide problem.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.
sec_parse_cmdline: Home directory name too large

Description (ERR):
The P3 home directory name exceeds the maximum allowed.
Response:
Correct the command line argument.
sec_parse_cmdline: Failed to allocate main p3 secondary home directory name: error reason

Description (CRIT):
The P3 secondary attempts to allocate the home directory name during initialization. If this fails, there is a system wide problem.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.
sec_parse_cmdline: Configuration filename too large

Description (ERR):
The P3 configuration filename exceeds the maximum allowed.
Response:
Correct the command line argument.
sec_parse_cmdline: Failed to allocate main p3 secondary configuration filename: error reason

Description (CRIT):
The P3 secondary attempts to allocate the configuration filename during initialization. If this fails, there is a system wide problem.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.
